main event: A bright green to yellow, flat elongated object with a tail was observed rapidly moving in almost horizontal flight, turning out, at an apparent altitude of 2000-3000 feet.
interesting points: The object appeared to be satellite-like and very bright at the time of the observation.
The description and information are characteristic of a satellite turning out, and such objects have been seen many times before.
The object rapidly moved from east to west at high speed over the clouds, burning out to the southwest.
The object was visible for about 5 seconds during daylight and was unlike a meteorite.
The observation lasted for approximately 15 minutes.
result: The information observed is not considered an 'Unidentified Flying Object' in the strict sense, and the sighting is likely attributable to a satellite or missile tracer.
sighted object: A bright green to yellow, flat elongated object with a tail
photographs: No photographs present in the image
